data.title: Walgreens Boots Alliance boss Stefano Pessina to step down
data.meta_description: The billionaire behind the American pharmacy chain that owns Boots is to step down as its boss, moving away from the day-to-day running of Walgreens Boots Alliance.Stefano Pessina, 79, the Italian-born dealmaker, will become executive chairman once a successor is found to replace him as chief execut
data.text:
The billionaire behind the American pharmacy chain that owns Boots is to step down as its boss, moving away from the day-to-day running of Walgreens Boots Alliance.

Stefano Pessina, 79, the Italian-born dealmaker, will become executive chairman once a successor is found to replace him as chief executive of the $34.6 billion retailer and wholesaler.

The change at the top will mark the end of an era for Mr Pessina, who has run the business since the merger of Walgreens and Alliance Boots that he orchestrated five years ago. Boots, the health and beauty chain, is one of Britain’s biggest high street retailers, with 2,465 stores and 54,000 staff.
